Great article. Recommended. I'd add 
1. Not using type inference but typing stuff unnecessarily, example const x: boolean = true;
2. Using the term "type casting" instead of "type assertion". The as keyword does not change runtime types!

tweets.text:
Four TypesScript code smells:

1. Using ‚Äúany‚Äù

2. Using ‚Äúas‚Äù

3. Not validating HTTP responses (via tools like Zod)

4. Setting ‚Äústrict‚Äù to false

Why? Because the items above increase the risk of runtime errors.
